abstract: Regional soccer confederation Concacaf attempts to turn tables on United States investigation of corruption by suing several parties involved in bribery of its officials; organization embraces role of victim, role formally endorsed by investigation, in seeking to recover funds.
lead_paragraph: The group, which oversees soccer in North America, Central America and the Caribbean, hopes to reclaim tens of millions it says it lost through a kickback scheme orchestrated by its former leaders.

headline.main: Concacaf, Embracing Status as Victim, Sues to Recover Travel Money
headline.print_headline: Concacaf, Embracing Its Status as Victim, Sues to Recover Travel Money

snippet: The group, which oversees soccer in North America, Central America and the Caribbean, hopes to reclaim tens of millions it says it lost through a kickback scheme orchestrated by its former leaders.

keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
